CIPHER.0.cipherString: Let us never negotiate out of fear. But let us never fear to negotiate.
CIPHER.0.question: Solve this aristocrat.

CIPHER.1.cipherString: Literary imagination is an aesthetic object offered by a writer to a lover of books.
CIPHER.1.question: Decode this sentence which has been encoded with an Affine cipher. (a,b)=(15,10).

CIPHER.2.cipherString: Culture is something that we all share, and we are all the poorer for anyone excluded from it.
CIPHER.2.question: Decode this sentence which has been encoded with an Affine cipher. (a,b)=(19,12).

CIPHER.3.cipherString: If you have nothing to hide, there is no reason not to be transparent.
CIPHER.3.question: Decode this sentence which has been encoded with an Affine cipher. (a,b)=(3,14).

CIPHER.4.cipherString: Being a father is the most important thing, if you ask me. It changed me as a person and gave me an all new life.
CIPHER.4.question: Decode this sentence which has been encoded with an Affine cipher. (a,b)=(7,7).

CIPHER.5.cipherString: Freedom was the desire of our people throughout centuries. Freedom enabled our people to be owners of their destiny.
CIPHER.5.question: Decode this sentence which has been encoded with an Affine cipher. (a,b)=(3,10).

CIPHER.6.cipherString: But pleasures are like poppies spread, You seize the flow'r, its bloom is shed.
CIPHER.6.question: Decode this sentence which has been encoded with an Affine cipher. (a,b)=(11,18).

CIPHER.7.cipherString: Photography can never grow up if it imitates some other medium. It has to walk alone; it has to be itself.
CIPHER.7.question: Decode this sentence which has been encoded with an Affine cipher. (a,b)=(9,6).

CIPHER.8.cipherString: I'm an actor, paid to act. I don't bring personal problems to the sets. Dad taught me that.
CIPHER.8.question: Decode this sentence which has been encoded with an Affine cipher. (a,b)=(19,3).

CIPHER.9.cipherString: Patriotism is when love of your own people comes first; nationalism, when hate for people other than your own comes first.
CIPHER.9.question: Decode this sentence which has been encoded with an Affine cipher. (a,b)=(15,6).

CIPHER.10.cipherString: Always look at what you have left. Never look at what you have lost.
CIPHER.10.question: Decode this sentence which has been encoded with an Affine cipher. (a,b)=(15,13).

CIPHER.11.cipherString: All happy families resemble one another, each unhappy family is unhappy in its own way.
CIPHER.11.question: Encode this sentence with the Affine cipher. (a,b)=(23,16).

CIPHER.12.cipherString: The Universe is one great kindergarten for man. Everything that exists has brought with it its own peculiar lesson.
CIPHER.12.question: Encode this sentence with the Affine cipher. (a,b)=(23,13).

CIPHER.13.cipherString: Sunsets are so beautiful that they almost seem as if we were looking through the gates of Heaven.
CIPHER.13.question: Encode this sentence with the Affine cipher. (a,b)=(9,15).

CIPHER.14.cipherString: Middle age occurs when you are too young to take up golf and too old to rush up to the net.
CIPHER.14.question: Encode this sentence with the Affine cipher. (a,b)=(19,19).

CIPHER.15.cipherString: It's quite highly possible that I have peaked. I mean, I just can't imagine what else I could do beyond this. It's really a bittersweet kind of feeling.
CIPHER.15.question: Encode this sentence with the Affine cipher. (a,b)=(19,13).

CIPHER.16.cipherString: I take my work seriously but I can't take myself too seriously. I'm in such a crazy privileged position.
CIPHER.16.question: Encode this sentence with the Affine cipher. (a,b)=(21,18).

CIPHER.17.cipherString: Welcome anything that comes to you, but do not long for anything else.
CIPHER.17.question: Encode this sentence with the Affine cipher. (a,b)=(5,7).

CIPHER.18.cipherString: Modeling is always something I've really admired because I've seen my mum and sister do it.
CIPHER.18.question: Encode this sentence with the Affine cipher. (a,b)=(23,9).

CIPHER.19.cipherString: Some people think luxury is the opposite of poverty. It is not. It is the opposite of vulgarity.
CIPHER.19.question: Encode this sentence with the Affine cipher. (a,b)=(15,7).

CIPHER.20.cipherString: Our nature hardly allows us to have enough of anything without having too much.
CIPHER.20.question: Encode this sentence with the Affine cipher. (a,b)=(7,22).
